step.title: Configuration
step.text: You will be asked to choose a preprocessing method. There are up to four options depending on data format of particular data field. Those options are: Interval enumeration, Equidistant intervals, Nominal enumeration, Each value - one bin.

step.title: Preprocessing - Interval enumeration
step.text: It is only possible with numeric formats. It distributes the data into intervals, which is good mainly for data with wide variability. That could be for example age, year, salary or any other data field with lots of different numbers. A wise choice of intervals can improve finding interesting rules.

step.title: Preprocessing - Equidistant intervals
step.text: Similar to interval enumeration except that the length of intervals is always the same. You can choose initial and final value and interval count. It will automatically create equidistant intervals according to the specified values.

step.title: Preprocessing - Nominal enumeration
step.text: Nominal enumeration is available for all formats. It allows you to create groups of values. This can be useful when there are many different values. Distributing them into several groups can help you to find more rules. Also make sure that the data in each group are somehow related (selecting random values ​​may result worse outcomes).

step.title: Preprocessing - Each value
step.text: As the name implies, each value is for itself. It is good for data fields where the data can take only few values such as ‘gender’ or ‘rating’. However you can use it for any other data field if it suits your needs.

step.title: Konfigurace
step.text: Budete vyzváni k výběru preprocessingové metody. Na výběr jsou až čtyři různé možnosti. Počet možností závisí na formátu dat příslušného datového pole. Možnosti jsou: Interval enumeration, Equidistant intervals, Nominal enumeration, Each value - one bin.
